page.title: 17 A DIALECT STORY-HARMBY
page.content: EACH PART OF YORKSHIRE HAS ITS OWN DIALECT.HERE IS A LOCAL EXAMPLE THAT WAS HEARD ON THE LEYBURN BUS.AN OLD DALESMAN GREETED A LADY: "NOW THEN,MISSUS,IT'S A COWD UN THIS MORNIN." "AYE"SHE REPLIED,"IT IS THAT!" "A THINK ITS COWDIST DAY WE'VE HAD YIT,"HE SAID. SHE THOUGHT A MINUTE AND THEN SAID: "NAY,A WEEANT HA THAT.IT WERE COWDER THAN THIS,TWO DAYS SIN." "D'YER THINK SO?"HE SAID."AYE"SHE REPLIED,"ITS T'ONLY TARM ME DISH CLOUTS BIN FROZZEN TO T'SINK." TRANSLATION:"HELLO MRS ITS A COLD MORNING." "YES,IT IS." "I THINK ITS THE COLDEST DAY WE'VE HAD YET."NO I WON'T HAVE THAT.IT WAS COLDER THAN THIS TWO DAYS AGO,""DO YOU THINK SO?" "YES. ITS THE ONLY TIME MY DISH CLOTH'S BEEN FROZEN TO THE SINK."
